summary.para: The Settings object provides access to various settings maintained by Double Agent. The properties are read-only for client applications, but the user can change them in the window.
This object can be accessed using the 's property.

item.term: The Settings object has the following properties:

remarks.para: For some properties, Double Agent return a relevant value only if a compatible speech engine has been installed and is enabled.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Control.Settings.AudioStatus

summary.para: Returns the status of the audio output channel.

member.param:
A numeric value that indicates the current audio output status.
0 The audio output channel is available.
1 Audio output is currently disabled.
3
Listening mode is active and the user is currently speaking.
4 The character is currently speaking.
5
Listening mode is active.
6 The audio output status could not be determined.

remarks.para: Your client application can use this property to determine whether it is appropriate to have your character speak or whether it is appropriate to try to turn on Listening mode (using the method).

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Control.Settings.BalloonEnabled

summary.para: Indicates if the word balloon for the and methods is enabled.

member.param: A boolean value that indicates if the word balloon is enabled.

remarks.para: This property reflects the Display spoken output in word balloon … option on the Output page of the window.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Control.Settings.SoundEffectsEnabled

summary.para: Indicates whether sound effects associated with a character's animations will play.

member.param: A boolean value that indicates if sound effects are enabled.

remarks.para: This property reflects the Play character sound effects option on the Output page of the window.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Control.Settings.SREnabled

summary.para: Indicates whether speech input is enabled.

member.param: A boolean value that indicates if speech input is enabled.

remarks.para: This property reflects the Characters listen for input option on the Speech Input page of the window.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Control.Settings.SRHotKey

summary.para: Returns the user's current setting for the Listening hotkey.

member.param: A string value that describes the current Listening hotkey.

remarks.para: This property reflects the When you press the … key option on the Speech Input page of the window.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Control.Settings.SRHotKeyTime

summary.para: Returns the current timeout delay for the Listening hotkey.

member.param: A numeric value that indicates the Listening hotkey timeout, in seconds.

remarks.para: This property reflects the And continue for … seconds … option on the Speech Input page of the window.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Control.Settings.SRListeningPrompt

summary.para: Indicates if a sound is played when Listening mode is activated or deactivated.

member.param: A boolean value that indicates if the Listening prompt is enabled.

remarks.para: This property reflects the Play tone when you can speak option on the Speech Input page of the window.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Control.Settings.SRListeningTip

summary.para: Indicates if the Listening Tip is shown when Listening mode is active.

member.param: A boolean value that indicates if the Listening Tip is enabled.

remarks.para: This property reflects the Display listening tips option on the Speech Input page of the window.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Control.Settings.TTSEnabled

summary.para: Indicates if spoken audio output is enabled.

member.param: A boolean value indicating if spoken output is enabled.

remarks.para: This property reflects the Play spoken audio option on the Output page of the window.

member.name: P:DoubleAgent.Control.Settings.TTSSpeed

summary.para: Returns the value of the text-to-speech rate configured by the user.

member.param: A numeric value that indicates the relative rate applied to text-to-speech. It ranges from 0 (slow) to 10 (fast). A value of 5 indicates no change to the speech engine's normal speaking speed.

remarks.para: This property reflects the Speaking speed option on the Output page of the window.
